div.head: An Advertisement to the Reader, touching the Errata.
div.p:
THat the Errata of this Booke, are g •• wne unto so great a number, is neither novum crime • , nor in auditum. We may with farre 〈…〉 complaine thereof, than we can amend it: yet for the present I have taken the best care I could, although not to prevent, yet to correct them. Such as are me •• ely literall, or no impediment to the sense, are left unto the Readers care, and ingenuity. The rest, th •
Greeke alone excepted, (which both for accent and for letter, hath beene exceeding much mistaken) are here collected to thy • and; and are these th • t follow. viz.
